### Welcome

Sho Miyazaki is a data scientist interested in legislative redistricting, financial markets, and rugby football. 

He is a LL.B. candidate in the Faculty of Law in Keio University, studying political science (major), Japanese literature and arts (minor), and statistics. 

After studying at Harvard College as a visiting student, he is now very motivated to study applied statistics, and wants to enroll in Ph.D. Program in Quantitative Social Science.

He is also affiliated with [Greenmantle](https://www.gmantle.com) and the [Algorithm-Assisted Redistricting Methodology (ALARM) Project](https://alarm-redist.github.io).
